sections.heading: About me
sections.content: Love pizza but I'm lactose intolerant.

sections.heading: Where I've been
sections.content: I worked most of my life in the security industry. I worked for a camera security company and a company that specialized in electric fences to keep thieves away. I always had an interest in web development and apps, so I decided to start my career change. An opportunity opened to attend Perpetual Education and I took it. Here I am with so much knowledge learned but more to learn.

sections.heading: Why this profession?
sections.content: I’ve wanted to be a web developer for quite some time but spent a lot of years self-teaching myself with not a lot of success. I only knew about this field because I had friends that did it and they showed me what they do. It’s been a goal of mine to be able to have a career in the tech industry, especially as a web developer. The ability to do something meaningful and also grow my career into any path I choose, is what I am building towards right now.

sections.heading: What I enjoy doing
sections.content: I love mountain biking and going on hikes. My wife and I got blessed with a baby girl late 2021. Before my baby was born, my friends and I would go camping two to three times a year. When I have some free time, I turn on the switch and play some mario kart.
